intro: Crossopetalum decussatum, commonly known as the crossleaf puya, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae, which includes plants known for their striking, often red or orange-colored flowers. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and distinctive, showy inflorescences that resemble a cross when viewed from above. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
